meanings.definition: A member of a group of extinct hominids that lived before the appearance of the earliest true humans.
meanings.sent1: The prehominid roamed the ancient forests in search of food.
meanings.sent2: Scientists study the bones of prehominids to learn about our evolutionary history.
meanings.sent3: The prehominid tried to use a stone as a tool but ended up just rolling it around.
meanings.sent4: In the museum, the skeleton of a prehominid stood as a silent witness to the past.
meanings.sent5: Children were fascinated by the exhibit showcasing the life of a prehominid.

meanings.definition: Relating to or characteristic of prehominids.
meanings.sent1: The prehominid traits in the fossil record helped scientists understand early human development.
meanings.sent2: The prehominid diet consisted mainly of fruits and nuts.
meanings.sent3: The prehominid-like behavior of the toddler amused the parents.
meanings.sent4: Her prehominid instincts kicked in when she sensed danger nearby.
meanings.sent5: The prehominid features of the ancient statue were strikingly realistic.
